item.title: 高盛将 2023 年三大高管薪酬上调 24
item.description: 这家华尔街巨头周五在一份文件中披露，高盛集团的前三名高管在 2023 年的薪酬将猛增近 24%。【原文：The top three executives at Goldman Sachs saw their pay jump nearly 24% in 2023, the Wall Street giant disclosed in a filing on Friday.】

item.title: 投资者认为婴儿配方奶粉诉讼将带来更多麻烦，利洁时股价下挫
item.description: 由于担心这家消费品公司将因其恩法米婴儿配方奶粉的相关诉讼而面临更多的财务责任，利洁时股价周五下跌超过 15%，创下十年来的最低点。【原文：Shares of Reckitt Benckiser dropped more than 15% on Friday to their lowest in a decade on fears that the consumer goods company would face more financial liabilities from lawsuits related to its Enfamil baby formula.】

item.title: 瑞士信贷拯救行动一年后，银行仍然脆弱不堪
item.description: 瑞士信贷银行（Credit Suisse）被竞争对手瑞银集团（UBS）收购一年后，瑞士当局仍在考虑如何弥补贷款机构的漏洞。【原文：A year after the banking crisis that felled Credit Suisse, authorities are still considering how to fix lenders' vulnerabilities - including in Switzerland, where the bank's takeover by rival UBS created a behemoth.】

item.title: 美国股票基金连续第三周吸引资金流入
item.description: 在截至3月13日的七天里，美国股票基金连续第三周吸引资金流入，投资者对华尔街的反弹持乐观态度，并对今年降息抱有希望，即使通胀依然顽固。【原文：U.S. equity funds drew inflows for a third consecutive week in the seven days to March 13, with investors optimistic about a rally on Wall Street and clinging to hopes of rate cuts this year, even as inflation proves stubborn.】

item.title: 梅赛德斯首席执行官大幅提高奖金，2023 年薪酬几乎翻番
item.description: 梅赛德斯-奔驰公司周五公布的一份报告显示，由于高额奖金的发放，该公司首席执行官奥拉-卡伦纽斯（Ola Kallenius）去年的薪酬几乎翻了一番。【原文：Mercedes-Benz CEO Ola Kallenius almost doubled his remuneration last year thanks to high bonus payouts, a company report published on Friday showed.】

item.title: 美国 3 月份消费者情绪和通胀预期稳定
item.description: 周五的一项调查显示，3月份美国消费者情绪和通胀预期变化不大。【原文：U.S. consumer sentiment and inflation expectations were little changed in March, a survey showed on Friday.】

item.title: 中国的 JD.com 放弃竞购 Currys
item.description: 在美国投资者埃利奥特顾问公司（Elliott Advisors）放弃竞购几天后，中国在线零售商京东商城（JD.com）周五表示，不会对英国电器集团 Currys 提出收购要约。【原文：Chinese online retailer JD.com said on Friday that it would not make an offer for British electricals group Currys , days after U.S. investor Elliott Advisors walked away from tabling a bid.】

item.title: 大众汽车美国财务部门支付 4875 万美元解决美国证券交易委员会柴油机诉讼案
item.description: 大众汽车集团美国公司全资拥有的财务部门已同意支付 4875 万美元，以解决政府指控这家德国汽车制造商及其前首席执行官在美国债券发行中欺诈投资者的诉讼。【原文：Volkswagen Group of America's wholly owned finance unit has agreed to pay $48.75 million to resolve a government lawsuit that accused the German automaker and its former CEO of defrauding investors in U.S. bond offerings.】

item.title: 投资者关注央行信号，全球股票基金吸引大量资金流入
item.description: 截至 3 月 13 日的一周内，全球股票基金出现了明显的资金流入，原因是投资者关注全球股市的强劲表现，而忽略了下周美联储会议前的通胀担忧，该会议可能为央行的降息时机提供线索。【原文：Global equity funds saw notable inflows in the week to March 13 as investors focused on strong global stock performances, overlooking inflation concerns ahead of the Federal Reserve meeting next week that could provide clues on the timing of the central bank's interest-rate cuts.】

item.title: 2 月份美国进口价格温和上涨
item.description: 由于石油产品成本的飙升被其他方面的小幅上涨部分抵消，2 月份美国进口价格小幅上涨，这对通胀前景是个好兆头。【原文：U.S. import prices increased marginally in February as a surge in the cost of petroleum products was partially offset by modest gains elsewhere, which bodes well for the inflation outlook.】

item.title: 中国 CATL 自 2022 年第二季度以来利润首次下降
item.description: 中国电动汽车电池制造商 CATL 周五公布了自 2022 年第二季度以来的首次季度净利润下滑，原因是在全球最大的汽车市场对电动汽车的需求减弱的情况下，该公司与规模较小的竞争对手展开了搏斗。【原文：Chinese EV battery maker CATL on Friday reported its first quarterly net profit decline since the second quarter of 2022 as it wrestled with smaller rivals amid waning demand for electric vehicles in the world's largest auto market.】

item.title: 苹果公司就中国销售问题与股东达成 4.9 亿美元和解协议
item.description: 周五的法庭文件显示，苹果公司已达成一项 4.9 亿美元的和解协议，以解决一起集体诉讼，该诉讼指控苹果公司首席执行官蒂姆-库克（Tim Cook）隐瞒中国市场对 iPhone 需求下降的事实，从而欺骗股东。【原文：Apple has reached a $490 million settlement to resolve a class-action lawsuit that accused Chief Executive Tim Cook of defrauding shareholders by concealing falling demand for iPhones in China, court papers showed on Friday.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，卡塔尔航空公司考虑向波音和空中客车公司订购多达 150 架宽体飞机
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周五援引知情人士的话报道，卡塔尔航空公司正在与波音公司和空中客车公司进行早期谈判，计划订购多达 150 架宽体喷气式飞机。【原文：Qatar Airways is in early talks with Boeing and Airbus to order up to 150 widebody jets, Bloomberg News reported on Friday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 英国《金融时报》报道：华盛顿威胁实施禁令，TikTok 在美国的收入达到 160 亿美元
item.description: 据英国《金融时报》周五报道，中国字节跳动公司旗下的 TikTok 去年在美国的收入约为 160 亿美元，而这款吸引了 Z 世代用户的病毒视频应用在美国正面临被禁的风险。【原文：China's ByteDance-owned TikTok posted revenue of about $16 billion last year in the United States, where the viral video app that has hooked Gen Z users is at the risk of being banned, the Financial Times reported on Friday.】

item.title: Adobe业绩下滑，因预期疲软引发对竞争和人工智能的担忧
item.description: Adobe公司的股价周五下跌了12%，原因是该公司乏善可陈的季度业绩预测引发了人们对激烈竞争的担忧，同时也让那些希望从人工智能生成集成中获得提振的投资者感到失望。【原文：Adobe's shares fell 12% on Friday as the company's lackluster quarterly forecast raised fears about strong competition and disappointed investors who were hoping for a boost from generative AI integrations.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织（IMF）称欧洲许多新兴经济体需要采取紧缩货币政策
item.description: 国际货币基金组织（IMF）的一位高级官员说，中欧、东欧和东南欧的基本通胀率要强于发达经济体，这就要求该地区的许多中央银行在比欧洲中央银行更长的时间内维持紧缩货币政策。【原文：Underlying inflation in central, eastern and southeastern Europe is stronger than in advanced economies, requiring many central banks in the region to maintain a tight monetary stance for longer than the European Central Bank, a top IMF official said.】

item.title: TikTok 禁播法案我们所了解的嘀嗒中国老板
item.description: 美国众议院本周以压倒性多数通过了一项法案，要求 TikTok 的中国所有者字节跳动在六个月内剥离短视频应用在美国的资产，否则将面临禁令，这是特朗普执政以来对该应用的最大威胁。【原文：The U.S. House of Representatives overwhelmingly passed a bill this week that would give TikTok's Chinese owner ByteDance about six months to divest the U.S. assets of the short video app, or face a ban, in the greatest threat to the app since the Trump administration.】

item.title: 大众汽车集团 2 月份交付量下降 1.1
item.description: 德国大众汽车公司周五表示，受中国市场大幅下滑的影响，该公司 2 月份的汽车交付量下降了 1.1%，降至 605,500 辆。【原文：Volkswagen group deliveries fell by 1.1% in February to 605,500 vehicles, hit by a sharp decrease in China, the German carmaker said on Friday.】

item.title: 利率峰值刺激了美国对高风险公司债的需求
item.description: 今年，美国市场上风险最高的公司债之一正在重新崛起，因为各家公司都在迎合投资者对资产的需求，这些资产可以在预期利率下降之前锁定数年的高收益。【原文：The U.S. market for one of the riskiest types of corporate debt is resurging this year, as companies cater to investor demand for assets that can lock in high yields for several years ahead of an expected decline in interest rates.】

item.title: 电动汽车销售放缓，美国汽车制造商竞相生产更多混合动力汽车
item.description: 随着美国油电混合动力汽车销量的激增和电动汽车销量的降温，汽车制造商和供应商打赌，消费者对全燃烧和全电动之间折中的需求将是一个持久的趋势。【原文：As U.S. sales of gas-electric hybrid vehicles surge and electric-vehicle sales cool, automakers and suppliers are betting consumer demand for a compromise between all-combustion and all-electric is a durable trend.】

item.title: 早间竞价国债 "鱼雷"，特斯拉 "水涨船高
item.description: Mike Dolan 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan】

item.title: 如果美国参议院继续执行禁令，TikTok 的广告商将转向竞争对手
item.description: 利用 TikTok 向年轻消费者进行营销的广告商正在与社交媒体竞争对手准备应急计划，以防该短视频应用在美国被出售或禁用，但他们正在等待参议院采取行动的迹象，然后再转移营销预算。【原文：Advertisers who turn to TikTok to market to young consumers are preparing contingency plans with social media rivals in the event the short-form video app is sold or banned in the U.S., but they are waiting for signs of Senate action before shifting marketing budgets.】

item.title: 美联储下周召开会议前期货几乎持平
item.description: 周五，美国股指期货变化不大，因为投资者正在为下周的美联储会议做准备，这次会议可能会为央行的降息时机提供线索。【原文：U.S. stock index futures were little changed on Friday as investors braced for a Federal Reserve meeting next week that could provide clues on the timing of the central bank's interest-rate cuts.】

item.title: 纽约时报》称麦当劳在澳大利亚、香港和日本遭遇技术困境
item.description: 纽约时报》称，快餐巨头麦当劳在澳大利亚、香港和日本的餐厅出现技术问题，该公司发言人周五证实了日本餐厅出现的故障。【原文：Customers of fast food giant McDonald's reported technical issues at its restaurants in Australia, Hong Kong and and Japan, the New York Times said, with a company spokesperson confirming the outage in Japan on Friday.】

item.title: 时不我待日本公司将加强对外并购
item.description: 随着日本企业巨头面临提高资本效率的压力，以及日本央行逐步放弃压低货币的政策，日本公司寻求海外交易的步伐必将加快。【原文：Japan Inc's pursuit of overseas deals is set to accelerate as the country's corporate giants come under pressure to boost capital efficiency and the central bank moves towards ditching policies that depressed the currency.】

item.title: 瑞士电信将以 8 亿欧元收购沃达丰意大利公司
item.description: 瑞士电信（Swisscom）周五表示，将以 80 亿欧元（87.0 亿美元）的价格收购沃达丰意大利公司（Vodafone Italia），并将该公司与其意大利子公司 Fastweb 合并。【原文：Swisscom said on Friday it will buy Vodafone Italia for 8 billion euros ($8.70 billion)to merge the business with its Italian subsidiary Fastweb.】

item.title: 英国央行将在首次降息前拖延时间
item.description: 英国央行下周可能会让投资者猜测它何时可能开始降息，因为它在等待更明确的迹象，表明经济中的通胀压力确实正在被抑制。【原文：The Bank of England will probably keep investors guessing next week about when it is likely to start cutting interest rates as it waits for clearer signs that inflation pressures still in the economy really are being quashed.】

item.title: 早间竞价反思美联储减息引发科技股震荡
item.description: 凯文-巴克兰对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Kevin Buckland】

item.title: 加密货币狂潮暂停，波动剧烈的比特币从纪录高位回落
item.description: 比特币在周五的震荡交易中跌至一周低点，原因是投资者从比特币创下的历史新高中获利了结，而且美国通胀再次出现上行意外，使得美国提前降息的前景暗淡，并削弱了对风险资产的需求。【原文：Bitcoin eased to a one-week low in volatile trade on Friday, as investors took profit from its run to a record high and as another upside surprise on U.S. inflation dimmed prospects of early rate cuts there and dented demand for riskier assets.】

item.title: 日本即将结束负利率试验
item.description: 日本央行即将结束长达八年的负利率政策，而历史性的工资上涨预期将使下周日本央行放弃大规模刺激计划的前景更加光明。【原文：The Bank of Japan is close to ending eight years of negative interest rate policy, with expected historical wage hikes heightening the prospect of a landmark shift away from its massive stimulus programme next week.】
